# start

**Instance Property**

An integer multiple of the frame interval at which the animation plays.

## Declaration

```swift
var start: TimeInterval { get set }
```

## Discussion

When calculating the visual beginning of a sampled animation, the framework first evaluates this property, and then applies the optional [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/SampledAnimation/trimStart], in seconds.

The framework requires this property to contain an integer multiple of [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/SampledAnimation/frameInterval]. Note that the value of this property can be irrational because frame interval is of type [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Foundation/TimeInterval].

## Timing the animation

- **frameInterval**: The duration within the animation timeline for each frame in the frames array.
- **end**: An integer multiple of the frame interval at which the animation stops.
- **speed**: A factor that changes the animation’s rate of playback.
- **delay**: An amount of time that elapses before the animation plays.
- **duration**: The total playback time of the animation.
- **offset**: The time, in seconds, at which the animation begins within the duration.
- **trimDuration**: An optional duration that overrides the calculated duration.
- **trimStart**: The optional time, in seconds, at which the animation plays.
- **trimEnd**: The optional time, in seconds, at which the animation stops.
